doc:
Lowell Sherman https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lowell_Sherman 0 Lowell J. Sherman (October 11, 1888 – December 28, 1934) was an American actor and film director. In an unusual practice for the time, he served as both actor and director on several films in the early 1930s. He later turned exclusively to directing. Having scored huge successes directing the films She Done Him Wrong (starring Mae West) and Morning Glory (which won Katharine Hepburn her first Academy Award), he was at the height of his career when he died after a brief illness. Lowell_J._Sherman ( October_11_,_1888 – December_28_,_1934 ) was an_American_actor_and_film_director . In an_unusual_practice for the_time , he served as both_actor_and_director on several_films in the_early_1930s . He later turned exclusively to directing . Having_scored huge_successes directing the_films She Done Him Wrong_( starring Mae_West_)_and_Morning_Glory ( which won Katharine_Hepburn her_first_Academy_Award_) , he was at the_height of his_career when he died after a_brief_illness .
